intro: Rorippa gambelii, commonly known as Gambel's watercress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. This species typically grows in moist or aquatic environments, such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a peppery taste, similar to watercress. It produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early summer.
